Detailed Description

This class implements a data descriptor for ODBC data sources.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

plODBCDataDescriptor::plODBCDataDescriptor ( const plVariablesConjunction &  variables,
const std::string &  host,
const std::string &  user,
const std::string &  passwd,
const std::string &  db,
const std::string &  query,
const std::string &  port,
const std::string &  driver_name 
)
inline

Constructor using database parameters and associating it to a set of variables.

Parameters
[in]variablesThe set of variables to be associated to the descriptor.
[in]hostHost name (address)
[in]userDatabase user name
[in]passwdUser's password
[in]dbDatabase name
[in]queryThe query to execute
[in]portPort number
[in]driver_nameDriver name

References PL_NO_ERROR, and set_variables().

plODBCDataDescriptor::plODBCDataDescriptor ( const std::string &  host,
const std::string &  user,
const std::string &  passwd,
const std::string &  db,
const std::string &  query,
const std::string &  port,
const std::string &  driver_name 
)
inline

Constructor using database parameters without associating it to a set of variables.

The actual association to a set of variables could be done later by calling set_variables().

Parameters
[in]hostHost name (address)
[in]userDatabase user name
[in]passwdUser's password
[in]dbDatabase name
[in]queryThe query to execute
[in]portPort number
[in]driver_nameDriver name

References PL_NO_ERROR.

Member Function Documentation

bool plODBCDataDescriptor::get_data_record ( const plValues *&  data_values,
const std::vector< bool > *&  data_definition 
)
inlinevirtual

Get the next data record (row) and advances by one record in the data.

Parameters
[out]data_valuesan array of values for all variables described in the record.
[out]data_definitiona vector stating, for each value in data_values, whether it's defined or not.
Returns
false iif the end of the container is reached.

The returned pointers are managed internally: you should not attempt to delete them, or use them after another call to get_data_record(). Also, you should not use them when get_data_record() returns false.

Implements plDataDescriptor.

References plODBCDataConnector::get_column_def(), plODBCDataConnector::next(), and plValues::size().

void plODBCDataDescriptor::set_variables ( const plVariablesConjunction &  variables)
inline

Set the variables to be associated to the data descriptor.

This method is to be called when the descriptor is constructed without providing the variables list. After this call, observed_variables() will return the passed 'variables' parameter.

Parameters
[in]variablesThe variables to be associated to the data descriptor

References plVariablesConjunction::dim(), get_num_fields(), plVariablesConjunction::get_type(), plVariablesConjunction::get_var_type(), plVariablesConjunction::is_empty(), PL_LABEL, and plValues::size().

Referenced by plODBCDataDescriptor().
